arm_group.description: There is only one arm as this is a pilot and feasibility study.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this feasibility study is to develop and initially test a dialogue-based
      psychosocial intervention aimed at promoting coping and psychosocial wellbeing following an
      acute stroke. The intervention is carried out by primary care registered nurses or other
      appropriate health professionals. The intervention included persons with and without
      aphasia.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 years old or above

          -  acute stroke

          -  4-8 weeks poststroke

        Exclusion Criteria

          -  Other serious disease

clinical_study.official_title: Psychosocial Wellbeing Following Stroke: Developing and Testing a Psychosocial Nursing Intervention for Primary Care

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Stroke and Aphasia Quality of Life (SAQOL-39)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 2 weeks after end of intervention

reference.citation: Kirkevold M, Bronken BA, Martinsen R, Kvigne K. Promoting psychosocial well-being following a stroke: developing a theoretically and empirically sound complex intervention. Int J Nurs Stud. 2012 Apr;49(4):386-97. doi: 10.1016/j.ijnurstu.2011.10.006. Epub 2011 Nov 1.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

results_reference.citation: Bronken BA, Kirkevold M. Between the lines: generating good qualitative data in studies involving persons with aphasia. ANS Adv Nurs Sci. 2013 Apr-Jun;36(2):E14-28. doi: 10.1097/ANS.0b013e318290200a.

Bronken BA, Kirkevold M, Martinsen R, Wyller TB, Kvigne K. Psychosocial well-being in persons with aphasia participating in a nursing intervention after stroke. Nurs Res Pract. 2012;2012:568242. doi: 10.1155/2012/568242. Epub 2012 Jul 22.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Stroke and Aphasia Quality of Life (SAQOL-39)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 12 months after end of intervention

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Health Services Research
